required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 09, 2023
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pain Control After Arthroscopic Shoulder Surgeries
clinical_study.official_title: Comparative Study of Analgesic Efficacy of Ultrasound Guided Interscalene Block Versus Combined Shoulder Anterior Capsular Block and Suprascapular Nerve Block for Arthroscopic Shoulder Surgeries.

brief_summary.textblock: This study will be conducted to compare the perioperative analgesic efficacy of ultrasound - guided interscalene brachial plexus block versus combined shoulder anterior capsular block and anterior suprascapular nerve block for arthroscopic shoulder surgeries.

primary_outcome.description: The first 24 hours post operative analgesic consumption

secondary_outcome.measure: Visual Analogue score (VAS) in the first 24 hours after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: - Postoperative pain intensity will be assessed in the first 24 hour using VAS score where (0 = no pain and 100 = the worst imaginable pain)
Patient satisfaction score will be assessed on the basis of a questionnaire and graded on a 4-point scale (excellent/good/fair/poor).

secondary_outcome.measure: The incidence of hemi diaphragmatic paralysis
secondary_outcome.time_frame: immediately before block and immediately after procedure

arm_group.description: In this group, ultrasound-guided ISB will be done using 10 ml of bupivacaine 0.25%.

arm_group.arm_group_label: group 2 Combined Ultrasound guided shoulder anterior capsular block and suprascapular nerve block
arm_group.description: , ultrasound-guided SHAC block will be done using 10 ml of bupivacaine 0.25% injected in the interfacial plane between deltoid and subscapular muscle and 10 ml of bupivacaine 0.25% injected in the pericapsular space. Ultrasound-guided SSN block will be done using 10 ml of bupivacaine 0.25% injected at sub omohyoid space.

intervention.description: ultrasound guided interscalene block versus combined ultrasound guided shoulder anterior capsular block and suprascapular nerve block for arthroscopic shoulder surgery

intervention.intervention_name: Combined Ultrasound guided shoulder anterior capsular block and suprascapular nerve block
intervention.description: Combined Ultrasound guided shoulder anterior capsular block and suprascapular nerve block
intervention.arm_group_label: group 2 Combined Ultrasound guided shoulder anterior capsular block and suprascapular nerve block
group 2 Combined Ultrasound guided shoulder anterior capsular block and suprascapular nerve block

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients aged 20-65 years of both sexes, with American Society of Anesthesiologists (ASA) physical status I or II admitted for arthroscopic shoulder surgery.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patient refusal.
- Uncooperative patient.
- Patient with neurological deficit.
- Patients with respiratory disorders.
- Patient with bleeding disorders.
- Infection at the block injection site.
- Patients with history of allergy to local anesthetics.

responsible_party.investigator_title: ASSISTANT LECTURER OF ANESTHESIA AND INTENSIVE CARE AND PAIN MEDICINE
